sections.title: Installation
sections.content:
Enter the UEFI menu by pressing F2 during Boot and disable the password and Secure Boot.

- Security -> Set password
- Security -> Disable Secure Boot
- Reset the password by setting the password again but letting the "New Password" fields blank.

sections.title: Function keys
sections.content:
Table content:
Key | Effect
Esc | Enables/disables Fn lock
F1 | XF86AudioMute
F2 | XF86AudioLowerVolume
F3 | XF86AudioRaiseVolume
F4 | XF86MonBrightnessDown
F5 | XF86MonBrightnessUp
F6 | Super_L + P
F7 | Invokes user-defined action if "xiaomi_wmi" module is loaded
F8 | Super_L + Tab
F9 | Enables/disables touchpad
F10 | Enables/disables keyboard backlight
F11 | Print
F12 | Insert

sections.title: Display
sections.content:
Factory display calibration is poor. Check the panel model:

```
$ edid-decode < /sys/class/drm/card0-eDP-1/edid | grep Alphanumeric
```

If it is NV156FHM-N61, try the ICC profiles at [1].

The path to the backlight is non-standard and causes tools like xorg-xbacklight to not work. To fix this issue, you have to setup Intel driver and add Backlight option to respective X-Org configuration file:

```
/etc/X11/xorg.conf.d/10-backlight.conf
```

```
Section "Device" 
        Identifier "Card0" 
        Driver     "intel" 
        Option     "Backlight"  "intel_backlight" 
        BusID      "PCI:0:2:0" 
EndSection
```

sections.title: Touchpad troubles
sections.content: You may face a problem when the kernel sees 2 touchpad devices if you have multiple touchpad devices displayed in libinput list-devices Try to add i8042.noaux kernel param

sections.title: TPM issues
sections.content: BIOS used in this model does not allow enabling SHA256 PCR bank, all measurements are done to SHA1 PCR bank only.
